arm_group.description: Semi-quantitative urine pregnancy test (SQPT) (dBest One Step hCG Panel Test Kit)

brief_summary.textblock:
The study seeks to test whether it is feasible and acceptable for both women and providers
      (in this context the Lady Health Visitor) to use the semi-quantitative pregnancy test (SQPT)
      as a tool for follow up after MR services. The study is planned at 11 service delivery
      points (primary health clinics) in Punjab province where consenting women will be asked to
      take a baseline test at the clinic the morning they present for the MR procedure. Women will
      be asked to complete a second test at home the morning of their scheduled follow up visit
      and return to the clinic for follow-up care later that day. The results of the at home test
      will be compared to the baseline to determine the outcome of the MR. This is of particular
      importance because to-date no research has documented the accuracy of the test in detecting
      MR outcomes with misoprostol only regimens.

      We hypothesize that women and providers will find the test easy and acceptable to use
      thereby improving follow up and simplifying MR service provision. The simple pictorial
      instructions will enable most women to use the test and interpret the results correctly on
      their own.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exploring the Role of At-home Semi-quantitative Pregnancy Tests for Follow-up to Menstrual Regulation Service

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Eligible for medical menstrual regulation services according to clinic guidelines

          -  Willing to follow instructions and use the SQPT at home

          -  Agrees to return for  a follow-up visit 7 days after receipt of misoprostol for the
             MR procedure

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Not eligible for medical menstrual regulation services according to clinic guidelines

          -  Not willing to follow instructions and use the SQPT at home

          -  Does not agree to return for  a follow-up visit 7 days after receipt of misoprostol
             for the MR procedure

intervention.other_name: semi-quantitative urine pregnancy test (SQPT) (dBest One Step hCG Panel Test Kit)

clinical_study.official_title: Simplifying Menstrual Regulation (MR): Exploring the Role of At-home Semi-quantitative Pregnancy Tests for Follow-up to Menstrual Regulation Service Provision in Pakistan

primary_outcome.description:
The proportion of woman for whom Human Chorionic Gonadotropin (hCG) remains the same after MR
The proportion of woman for whom hCG remains increases after MR
The proportion of woman for whom hCG declines after MR
Any additional care received by women in each of the above groups (1-3) will also be described
primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility to determine successful completion of MR

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of women who correctly read and interpreted their results
Proportion of women who were confident in using the test and would be willing to use it for follow up in the future
Proportion of women selecting a method of family planning and receiving that method at their initial clinic visit.
secondary_outcome.measure: Selecting and receiving family planning method

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
